description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 7-11 December
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey updates and other news 7-11 December - BBC News
maintext:
Over 50s and high-risk islanders in Jersey could be vaccinated against Covid-19 by Easter, the island's deputy medical officer of health has said.
Dr Ivan Muscat said the time-frame was a "guess", adding he had not been given a precise schedule for other groups.
Care home residents are set to be the first islanders to receive the Pfizer/BioNTech jab on Monday.
Dr Muscat said the vaccine was being allocated on a priority basis in accordance with recommendations set out by the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation (JCVI), which also advises the UK.
